H0.text: Which spectacular ridge connects Helvellyn with the Patterdale Valley. Striding Edge

H1.text: Which spectacular ridge connects Helvellyn with the Patterdale Valley. Swirral Edge

H2.text: Which spectacular ridge connects Helvellyn with the Patterdale Valley. Fairfield Ridge

H3.text: Which spectacular ridge connects Helvellyn with the Patterdale Valley. Helvellyn

A4.text: Striding Edge is a popular route which involves some scrambling, linking the summit ridge of Birkhouse Moor to Helvellyn's summit by what becomes a sharp arête.

A5.text: The north-east ridge is Swirral Edge, a sharp arête which joins the summit ridge at a point half-way along, and which terminates in the shapely pyramid of Catstye Cam.

A6.text: Grisedale Tarn is the starting point for the south ridge of Helvellyn, and may be reached from Grasmere or Patterdale, or from Dunmail Raise by a path alongside Raise Beck.

A7.text: The south ridge continues the main ridge of the Helvellyn range over Nethermost Pike, High Crag and Dollywagon Pike to terminate at Grisedale Tarn.

A8.text: Helvellyn can be climbed via Striding Edge

A9.text: Striding Edge path up to Helvellyn
